title: Regulation (EEC) No 2765/75 of the Council of 29 October 1975 on the general rules to be applied in the event of a substantial rise in pigmeat prices
header:
REGULATION (EEC) No 2765/75 OF THE COUNCIL  of 29 October 1975  on the general rules to be applied in the event of a substantial rise in pigmeat prices
THE COUNCIL OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body:
1. When the conditions referred to in the first paragraph of Article 11 of Regulation (EEC) No 2759/75 are fulfilled, in accordance with the criteria  (1)See page 1 of this Official Journal. (2)See page 17 of this Official Journal. (3)OJ No L 76, 28.3.1968, p. 13.
laid down in Article 1 of this Regulation, the total or partial suspension of the levy fixed in pursuance of Article 8 of Regulation (EEC) No 2759/75 may be decided upon according to the procedure laid down in Article 24 of that Regulation.
2. The measures provided for in paragraph 1 may be taken in respect of one or more of the products listed in Article 1 (1) of Regulation (EEC) No 2759/75 in the light of the market situation.
The information on which the measures provided for in Article 2 are based shall be reviewed regularly in accordance with the procedure provided for in Article 25 of Regulation (EEC) No 2759/75.

1. Council Regulation (EEC) No 897/69 (1) of 13 May 1969 on the general rules to be applied in the event of a substantial rise in pigmeat prices, is hereby repealed.
2. References to the Regulation repealed by paragraph 1 shall be construed as references to this Regulation.

This Regulation shall enter into force on 1 November 1975.
This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all Member States.
attachments:
Done at Luxembourg, 29 October 1975.
For the Council
The President
G. MARCORA
